In 2022 the Lieutenant Governor had amended the land rules for the meadow, which are being implemented now. Peerzada Ashiq captures the mood in Kashmir’s skiing destination, as the legal battle enters the final phase

title: Manipur bans two cough syrup brands containing ‘highly toxic’ chemical
description: Drugs Control Administration issued a "public alert warning consumers, retailers, and healthcare providers against the purchase and use of two cough syrup brands found to be adulterated with a highly toxic chemical, diethylene glycol."

IASGCON 2025 opens in Chennai with focus on GI oncology, AI and innovation

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal plays doctor for Shubman Gill after on-field collision - Watch
description: Yashasvi Jaiswal's unbeaten 173 powered India to a dominant 318/2 against West Indies on Day 1. A lighthearted moment saw Jaiswal humorously check captain Shubman Gill for concussion after a collision. Jaiswal's exceptional knock, his second 150+ on Day 1 in India, puts him in elite company, setting the stage for a potential series sweep.

title: Main accused in Raebareli Dalit man lynching case arrested after police encounter
'Gaza will be rebuilt': Trump on ceasefire; will set up a 'board of peace'
description: US President Donald Trump expressed optimism for the Israel-Hamas ceasefire, anticipating Gaza's rebuilding with Arab funding and the establishment of a "Board of Peace." He highlighted the significant retribution against Hamas and the widespread desire for peace across the Middle East, calling the deal beneficial for all.

title: Don’t target people: Sambhal MP to administration over claim of mosque, homes on ‘pond’
'Opportunity to get a 300': Kumble hails Jaiswal's hunger for big scores
description: Legendary spinner Anil Kumble lauded young opener Yashasvi Jaiswal's unbeaten 173 on day one of the second Test against West Indies. Kumble believes Jaiswal's hunger and ability to convert starts into big scores present a golden opportunity for him to achieve a historic triple century on Saturday, joining elite Indian batters.

title: CMRL work leaves stretches of Arcot Road in poor shape
description: At many locations in Virugambakkam and Valasaravakkam, the road is damaged and riddled with craters, say commuters; construction materials and trucks on the road add to the woes, they add

title: In wish list of Afghan refugees in Delhi — schools, better jobs & flights to visit kin back home
Killer cough syrup
description: Twenty-four children have died in Madhya Pradesh and three others are in a critical condition after consuming an adulterated cough syrup. Lab tests show that the syrup contained a high concentration of diethylene glycol, an industrial solvent that is never used in medicine. Bindu Shajan Perappadan and Mehul Malpani report on the horror that highlights the dangers of India’s weak regulatory system

title: Days after shoe hurled at CJI, 2 additional security personnel deployed outside Court 1 in SC
Chennai Snake Park to study tribal snakebite remedies
description: The study will focus on herbs used by tribal communities in Tamil Nadu, especially the Irulas, who possess deep knowledge of venomous snakes and local medicinal plants.

title: Dept. of Posts releases picture postcards on ‘The Hues of Tamil Nadu’
description: The release of picture postcards was part of the Department’s efforts to promote philately, and engage people in creative and educational postal initiatives, the release said.

title: SETC to operate multi-axle buses of Volvo soon
description: A senior official of the SETC said the multi-axle buses, expected to ply in the State by December this year, would set a benchmark in terms of passenger comfort and driving ergonomics.

title: Two weather systems to bring heavy rainfall across T.N. till October 13
description: While the northeast monsoon is likely to arrive around October 16-18, the RMC has noted that districts like Tirunelveli and Tenkasi in extreme southern T.N. may experience below-normal rainfall during the upcoming season.

title: RRI technique yields certified randomness with one qubit
description: Researchers built simple quantum circuits on IBM’s superconducting quantum computers, which are available on the cloud; the experiments successfully produced random numbers certified by quantum mechanics, and which classical randomness can’t fake

title: 'Usko lagna nahi chahiye!' - Nayar turns bodyguard for Rohit Sharma
description: Former India cricketer Abhishek Nayar shielded Rohit Sharma from an overwhelming crowd outside Mumbai's Shivaji Park, pleading for the star to avoid injury. The viral clip highlights the intense fan passion surrounding Rohit, even after his ODI captaincy change, as he trains for the upcoming Australia tour.

title: NMC data shows India added just 21 docs in a year when 80k graduated
description: India's doctor count appears stagnant, with the National Medical Commission (NMC) data showing minimal growth despite thousands graduating annually. Significant discrepancies exist between NMC figures and state medical council registrations, raising concerns about accurate healthcare planning and potentially misleading Parliament.

title: India must pivot to high-value, tech-intensive production to achieve $1 trillion merchandise exports target: White Paper
description: The findings underscore that export growth cannot rely on GDP expansion alone

title: Haryana IPS officer suicide: No culprit must be spared, Chirag writes to Saini
We're sure Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh taking action: Centre on cough syrup deaths
description: The Supreme Court expressed concern over child deaths in Madhya Pradesh due to contaminated cough syrup but refused to monitor a probe. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta intervened, stating states are addressing the issue, and the court should trust them to act. The PIL was dismissed as the petitioner has a history of filing similar petitions.

title: Punjab’s farmers struggle to reclaim flood-hit land amid ‘official apathy’
description: In August and September, Punjab faced one of its worst floods in decades, affecting more than 20 lakh people across 2,614 villages and displacing 6.87 lakh people

title: Delhi Confidential: Thank you dinner
Ahead of taking charge, US envoy Sergio Gor in India to meet officials on bilateral ties
description: US ambassador-designate to India, Sergio Gor, is visiting India for pre-assumption charge discussions on bilateral issues and strengthening the strategic partnership. The US embassy also clarified that recent foreign military sales amendments do not include new missile deliveries or upgrades for Pakistan. This visit precedes potential meetings between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump.

title: First-term NDA cadet found dead in his cabin; Pune police suspect suicide
description: A first-term National Defence Academy cadet, Antriksh Kumar Singh, was found dead in his cabin, with police suspecting suicide. The 18-year-old from Lucknow had reportedly expressed stress over issues with senior cadets. A Court of Inquiry has been ordered to investigate the circumstances surrounding his death.

title: Odisha State Information Commission influenced by bureaucracy, red tapism, observes Orissa HC
description: Travail of petitioner who was denied information reminds of the plight of the protagonist ‘Josef’ in Kafka’s celebrated works ‘The Trial’ where he faces nightmarish bureaucracy that seems designed to confuse, remarks the HC

title: SC questions HC order for SIT probe into Karur stampede
description: The Supreme Court questioned the Madras High Court's principal bench for ordering an SIT probe into the Karur stampede, bypassing the Madurai bench's jurisdiction and the original petition's focus on rally protocols. Justices Maheshwari and Anjaria also queried Tamil Nadu on permitting the rally despite denying others and the unusual midnight postmortems. TVK sought a retired SC judge's supervision for the probe, citing concerns over state officials' impartiality.

title: Repatriate pregnant woman: Bangladesh court to Indian mission
description: A pregnant woman, wrongly deported to Bangladesh as an "illegal immigrant," is set to return to India following a judicial order. Sunali Khatun and five others, identified by Aadhaar cards, were pushed across the border by Delhi Police. A Bangladeshi court has directed the Indian High Commission to facilitate their safe repatriation, highlighting concerns over the police's hasty actions and the plight of the detained individuals.

title: Horoscope Today for October 11, 2025: Key Astrological Trends Affecting Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and Other Zodiac Signs
‘Highhanded action’: Gujarat HC raps Khambhat Municipality as shop ‘partially razed’
Supreme Court seeks government, EC response on allowing undertrials to vote
description: A Public Interest Litigation in the Supreme Court questions why undertrial prisoners, presumed innocent, are denied voting rights under Section 62(5) of the Representation of People Act. The petition highlights that an estimated five lakh undertrials are disenfranchised, a situation contrasting with practices in other nations. The court has sought responses from the Centre and the Election Commission, though a similar plea was dismissed previously.

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari demands action against CM Mamata Banerjee for ‘threatening Chief Electoral Officer’
description: Suvendu Adhikari also demanded that by Monday, the Chief Minister must submit proof of the corruption allegations that she levelled against the CEO, and the complaints of the electoral officers who were allegedly intimidated

title: Trade war reignites: Trump announces new 100% tariff on Chinese goods; impact from Nov 1
On Diwali, ‘green crackers’ set to return with a bang
description: The Supreme Court is poised to permit the sale and use of green firecrackers in Delhi and NCR for Diwali, Gurupurav, and Christmas. While reserving orders, the bench questioned the necessity of a complete ban, noting no significant increase in pollution attributed to crackers. The government proposed strict measures, including a ban on series crackers and online sales, to ensure only approved green crackers are available.

title: Bharatpur institution seeks PM’s intervention for development of Mewat region
description: The Samriddh Bharat Abhiyan has pointed out that unemployment is the biggest issue confronting the youth in the region

title: Eight Indians, 10 firms face US sanctions over Iran oil link
description: America has sanctioned eight Indian individuals and ten companies. These actions are due to their involvement in trading Iranian oil. The US State Department and Treasury targeted numerous entities globally. Several Indian firms are accused of importing Iranian-origin petrochemicals and LPG. These shipments were destined for China and Pakistan. The sanctions highlight ongoing efforts to curb Iran's oil trade.

title: Mother of Morbi youth caught in Ukraine war appeals to CM: ‘We only want him to be back home safe’
Cam Newton: Fans say 'he can’t afford it' as QB welcomes ninth child
description: NFL star Cam Newton has welcomed his ninth child. This is his second child with girlfriend Jasmin Brown. Newton now has nine children from various relationships. Fans are reacting with excitement and questions about his finances. Newton has spoken about financial challenges post-NFL but finds purpose in fatherhood. He embraces raising his children with dedication.

title: High drama at sea: A hot chase and a fake storm alert ends in arrest of rape accused

India elevates its ties with Taliban, to reopen embassy
description: India is upgrading its technical mission in Kabul to an embassy. This significant step follows a visit by Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi. India announced new projects and humanitarian aid for Afghanistan. Both sides condemned cross-border terrorism. India reaffirmed its commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty. The visit aims to boost diplomatic and economic ties.

title: Former Nepal PM asks why Army could not protect govt secretariat
ED arrests 4 involved in Rs 100cr racket linked to digital arrests
description: The ED has arrested four individuals in Ahmedabad in a Rs 100-crore extortion case involving digital arrests and illegal forex trading. Accused allegedly laundered over Rs 100 crore through bank accounts and converted proceeds into cryptocurrency. This is part of a larger crackdown on cybercrimes where the ED has attached over Rs 8,500 crore in assets.

title: Kayla Nicole backs diss tracks amid Taylor Swift ‘Opalite’ drama
description: Taylor Swift's new album has fans buzzing, with one song sparking speculation about Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole. Instead of engaging in online drama, Nicole used her podcast to advocate for artists settling disputes through music, citing Cardi B and Nicki Minaj. She also subtly responded on social media, demonstrating a calm approach to celebrity gossip.

title: Craig Heist passes away at 66: The voice who defined Nationals baseball for decades
description: Washington sports has lost a beloved voice with the passing of Craig Heist, 66, renowned for his coverage of the Nationals on 106.7 The Fan.  Heist, a fixture in press boxes for over four decades, was celebrated for his passion, humor, and kindness.  His impactful career, marked by multiple Sportscaster of the Year awards, leaves a significant void.

title: Gun licence row: Sena neta Ramdas Kadam targets legislative council chair
Himachal BJP chief's brother held in rape case, party calls it 'political' plot
description: Himachal Pradesh BJP chief's elder brother, Ram Kumar Bindal, was arrested for allegedly raping a 25-year-old woman during a medical examination. The survivor claims she was assaulted under the guise of Ayurvedic treatment. The BJP has called the accusation a politically motivated act, while police are investigating.

title: Centre in Supreme Court: In talks with J&K government on statehood restoration
description: The Centre informed the Supreme Court it's consulting Jammu and Kashmir's elected government on restoring statehood, excluding Ladakh's Union Territory status. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta stated the government will respond to pleas for statehood restoration within four weeks, citing security concerns like cross-border terrorism. Pleas highlight the breach of an earlier undertaking to restore statehood post-elections.

title: Man beaten to death, Army jawan critical after clash in dhaba over ‘food served cold’
description: Tragedy struck in Bijnor's Haldaur area where a 22-year-old man was beaten to death and his Army jawan cousin critically injured after a dispute over cold food at a dhaba. Police have suspended three officers for dereliction of duty following the incident. Two main accused have been arrested, with a murder case registered against five individuals. Angry villagers protested, demanding swift justice.

title: Influx from Pakistan, Bangladesh fuelling disparity in population growth: Amit Shah
description: Home Minister Amit Shah asserted that infiltration, not fertility, drives demographic shifts, posing a threat to India's culture and democratic ethos. He vowed a "detect, delete and deport" strategy against infiltrators, linking their inclusion in voter lists to constitutional corruption. Shah also defended the CAA as a national pledge fulfilled.

The Englishman, who has long-maintained his innocence, has no interest in returning as a professional but wants to shape the lives of the next generation of cueists.

title: Renaissance man – charting the white-ball legacy of Rohit Sharma
description: From 2017 to 2025, the Mumbaikar captained India in 118 limited-overs games and won more than three-fourths of those. But the 38-year-old left an imprint far deeper than mere numbers. He was a players’ leader – calm, humble and empathetic, and master-minded India’s reboot into becoming one of history’s best cricketing sides.

Centre denies nod for Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s Gulf tour
description: The Union government has reportedly denied permission for Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's 15-day Gulf tour, scheduled to begin on October 16. The Ministry of External Affairs rejected the clearance without specifying reasons. The trip was intended as an outreach program by Malayalam Mission but held political significance ahead of state assembly elections.

The arrests followed the discovery of a Rs 1 crore financial transaction in the PSOs' bank accounts. This brings the total arrests in the case to seven, with the singer's wife and a political leader expressing concerns about the investigation's transparency.

description: A powerful explosion rocked a military explosives manufacturing facility in rural Tennessee on Friday morning, causing homes to shake and prompting an emergency response. Footage showed burning debris and smoke rising from the facility near Bucksnort.

title: Microsoft engineer quits: emails thousands of staff; says can't enable war
description: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
description: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: DCC’s Kelli Finglass returns with empowering message in Mississippi
description: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders director Kelli Finglass headlined Forrest Health's Spirit of Women luncheon in Hattiesburg, sharing a message of empowerment and resilience. The event, themed "The Grit Behind the Glam," celebrated women's strength and perseverance.  Finglass's keynote speech, reflecting on her leadership journey, deeply resonated with attendees, marking a significant comeback for the annual gathering.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage with family photos after remarks
description: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, has ignited fan fury with a recent Instagram post after previously admitting she didn't want marriage or children. Her "Life lately" caption, featuring family photos, drew sharp criticism, with followers questioning her sincerity and urging Stephen to reconsider their union. The couple has remained silent amidst the backlash.
